intro: Hieracium substoloniferum subsp. erectum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with basal leaves that are elongated and often hairy. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
